title: Error in using categorical features in Census income classification with LightGBM notebook?
body:
I'm trying to replicate the example in the Census income classification with LightGBM notebook, and I am training the model with `X, y` vs `X_display, y_display` expecting to get the same TreeExplainer. But this is not the case.

I'm using the following code to build the train/test sets:

```python
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.2, random_state=7)
Xd_train, Xd_test, yd_train, yd_test = train_test_split(X_display, y_display, test_size=0.2, random_state=7)
```

Now, if I train the model using `X, y` but while explicitely using the `categorical_feature` parameter , I get the same results as the ones I get with `X_display, y_display`:

```python
# build train and test sets
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.2, random_state=7)

# get categorical features from X_display
cat_cols = X_display.select_dtypes(include=['category']).columns
categorical_feature = [c for c, col in enumerate(X_display.columns) if col in cat_cols]

# explicitely specify categorical features
d_train = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=categorical_feature)
d_test = lgb.Dataset(X_test, label=y_test, categorical_feature=categorical_feature)
```

So which one is the correct one? Am I missing something?
